p: The news is not all bleak, however. Recently, there is some sense that the narrative has shifted. International agencies such as UNAIDS, the World Health Organization and PEPFAR have an increased focus on men and HIV. Some countries have developed, or are formulating, national strategic plans on men and HIV [ 12]. Using Demographic and Health Surveys data, researchers recently characterized the “missing men” in six African countries, highlighting the particular need to reach poor single men without children in rural areas [ 2]. Others are researching the preferences of men, to inform the development of effective programmes. These are important steps towards ensuring that men are part of the HIV response.
